description.en:
Fuzzy logic has proved to be a straightforward though powerful tool for solving problems in several fields. In particular, its synergic use with  neurocomputing and evolutionary computing has allowed to build robust intelligent systems. Such ensemble of techniques is referred to as Soft Computing. This course introduces soft computing methods, ranging from the classical notions behind the fuzzy logic to
neuro-fuzzy systems, including some of the latest advancements in the field. One of these is granular
computing, meant as a new neurocomputing paradigm allowing more accurate and transparent (or interpretable) models. The course also comprises the practical application of the single or combined techniques to several classes of problems, such as control, prediction, classification. The course is self-contained, though it may be regarded as a complement of the Neural Networks course.
description.et:
Hägus loogika on kujunenud tõhusaks vahendiks probleemide lahendamisel erinevates valdkondades. Selle sünergiline kasutamine koos neuroarvutustega ja evolutsiooniliste tehnikatega võimaldab luua töökindlaid intelligentseid süsteeme. Sellist erinevate meetodite kombinatsiooni tuntakse ka kui ligikaudseid arvutusmeetodeid. Käesolev kursus tutvustab erinevaid ligikaudsete arvutusmeetodeid nt nn klassikalised hägusloogika süsteemid, hägusad neurosüsteemid, granulaarne arvutamine. Granulaarne arvutamine on uus neuroarvutuste paradigma, mis võimaldab luua täpsemaid ja
paremini tõlgendatavaid mudeleid. Kursuse käigus võrreldakse ka üksikute ja kombineeritud tehnikate
kasutamise tulemusi praktilistes olukordades.

objectives.en:
* To introduce students to the main topics and some of the latest advancements in fuzzy logic and soft computing (such as neuro-fuzzy systems, evolutionary techniques, granular computing)
* To provide an essential exposition of the aim and the techniques of soft computing
* To enable the students to apply these techniques to solve some classes of problems
objectives.et:
Tutvustada tudengitele peamiseid teemasi ja arenguid hägusa loogika ja ligikaudse arvutusmeetodite valkdonnas (nt neuro-hägusad süsteemid, evolutsioonilised tehnikad, granulaarne arvutamine)
Õpetada tudengitele ligikaudsete arvutusmeetodite eesmärke ja tehnikaid Õpetada tudengitele nende tehnikate kasutamist erinevate tüüpprobleemide lahendamisel.

learning_outcomes.en: On successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
* describe and argue the main issues related to fuzzy logic and soft computing;
learning_outcomes.et: -Oskab kirjeldada ja argumenteerida hajusa loogika ja ligikaudsete arvutusmeetodite teemadel;

learning_outcomes.en: * use properly at least two of the soft computing techniques;
learning_outcomes.et: -Oskab kasutada vähemalt kahte ligikaudse arvutuse meetodit;

learning_outcomes.en: * identify and implement a suitable soft computing technique to solve a given problem.
learning_outcomes.et: -Oskab valida ja rakendada sobivat ligikaudse arvutamise meetodit probleemi lahendamiseks.

independent_work.et: Independent work will consist of assignments and a final project with a short report.

description.et:
A project, consisting of a numerical case study (discussed in a short report/poster),  under the supervision of the lecturer, will be evaluated at the end of the course. 
For the project, the assessment will depend on the complexity of the problem, the overall quality of the report/poster.
Small exercises will be assigned and evaluated during the course.
Two mini-tests, with six (multiple-choice) questions, will cover the basic notions. There will be no time constraints, no penalties.
A short presentation based on a relevant article will also be assessed.

grade_preconditions.et: The homework should be submitted in due time and positively graded.

grade_evaluation.et:
Required:
- 2 mini-tests (up to 12 points, no time constraints, no penalties),
- 1 homework assignment (up to 14 points),
- 1 short presentation (up to 14 points),
- final project (up to 30 points).
To pass: 51 points
